trans-unit.source: To perform an offline backup of a database, use operating system commands to copy the database directory.

seg-source.mrk: To perform an offline backup of a database, use operating system commands to copy the database directory.

target.mrk: To perform an offline backup of a database, use operating system commands to copy the database directory.

trans-unit.source: You must shut down the database before you perform an offline backup.

seg-source.mrk: You must shut down the database before you perform an offline backup.

target.mrk: You must shut down the database before you perform an offline backup.

trans-unit.source: For example, on Windows systems, the following operating system command backs up a (closed) database that is named <codeph>sample</codeph> and that is located in <codeph>d:\mydatabases</codeph> by copying it to the directory <codeph>c:\mybackups\2012-04-01</codeph>:

seg-source.mrk: For example, on Windows systems, the following operating system command backs up a (closed) database that is named <codeph>sample</codeph> and that is located in <codeph>d:\mydatabases</codeph> by copying it to the directory <codeph>c:\mybackups\2012-04-01</codeph>:

target.mrk: For example, on Windows systems, the following operating system command backs up a (closed) database that is named <codeph>sample</codeph> and that is located in <codeph>d:\mydatabases</codeph> by copying it to the directory <codeph>c:\mybackups\2012-04-01</codeph>:

trans-unit.source: If you are not using Windows, substitute the appropriate operating system command for copying a directory and all contents to a new location.

seg-source.mrk: If you are not using Windows, substitute the appropriate operating system command for copying a directory and all contents to a new location.

target.mrk: If you are not using Windows, substitute the appropriate operating system command for copying a directory and all contents to a new location.

trans-unit.source: On Windows systems, do not attempt to update a database while it is being backed up in this way. Attempting to update a database during an offline backup will generate a <codeph>java.io.IOException</codeph>. Using online backups prevents this from occurring.

seg-source.mrk: On Windows systems, do not attempt to update a database while it is being backed up in this way.
Attempting to update a database during an offline backup will generate a <codeph>java.io.IOException</codeph>.
Using online backups prevents this from occurring.

target.mrk: On Windows systems, do not attempt to update a database while it is being backed up in this way.
Attempting to update a database during an offline backup will generate a <codeph>java.io.IOException</codeph>.
Using online backups prevents this from occurring.

trans-unit.source: For large systems, shutting down the database might not be convenient. To back up a database without having to shut it down, you can use an online backup.

seg-source.mrk: For large systems, shutting down the database might not be convenient.
To back up a database without having to shut it down, you can use an online backup.

target.mrk: For large systems, shutting down the database might not be convenient.
To back up a database without having to shut it down, you can use an online backup.

trans-unit.source: After you back up a database, make sure the backup copy is not corrupt. To do this, run the <codeph>SYSCS_UTIL.SYSCS_CHECK_TABLE</codeph> system function on all the tables in the backup copy. Do not discard the previous backup until you have verified the consistency of the current one. See <xref href="cadminconsist01.dita#cadminconsist01"></xref> for more information.

seg-source.mrk: After you back up a database, make sure the backup copy is not corrupt.
To do this, run the <codeph>SYSCS_UTIL.SYSCS_CHECK_TABLE</codeph> system function on all the tables in the backup copy.
Do not discard the previous backup until you have verified the consistency of the current one.

target.mrk: After you back up a database, make sure the backup copy is not corrupt.
To do this, run the <codeph>SYSCS_UTIL.SYSCS_CHECK_TABLE</codeph> system function on all the tables in the backup copy.
Do not discard the previous backup until you have verified the consistency of the current one.
